summary: This document is a series of email updates regarding the psychological and medical status of inmate Jeffrey Epstein at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York. It details his complaints of numbness, sleep issues, and his pending return to the Special Housing Unit (SHU), with staff assessing him as psychologically stable.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The primary subject of the medical and psychological observation reports. He complains of numbness in his arm and neck, sleep apnea, and expresses a desire to stay in a 'safe' area rather than return to the SHU.

persons.name: Lopez
persons.context: Another inmate (ID #20472-038) who is being taken off of psychological observation, mentioned in the same facility log as Epstein.

events.title: Epstein's Medical Complaints and Observation
events.description: Epstein complains of numbness in his right arm and neck, and a running toilet in his cell. He is seen by a nurse and remains on psychological observation.

events.title: Planned Return to SHU
events.description: Epstein is scheduled to return to the Special Housing Unit (SHU) after receiving his CPAP machine for sleep apnea. Staff explain he cannot remain in the hospital area for comfort and that he will be placed in a safe situation in the SHU.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, 150 Park Row, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: On July 29, 2019, Jeffrey Epstein was assessed as psychologically stable by prison staff but complained of physical symptoms including numbness in his arm and neck.
Epstein cited sleep apnea as potentially impairing his memory regarding a neck injury and was due to receive a CPAP machine.
Epstein requested to remain in the hospital area where he felt 'safe,' but staff denied this, stating he would be returned to the Special Housing Unit (SHU) the following day.
The document shows prison officials were actively monitoring Epstein's psychological state and living conditions just days before his death.
Another inmate, Lopez, was being processed off psychological observation in the same facility log entry.
